result.execSummary:
The defendant Andres Carmona Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $250.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs are to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:45 PM: Defendant Andres Carmona Ramirez in court, appearing in person, with attorney Andrea Love Sumpter, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.    Interpreter oath given by the Court.  ADA recites terms of resolution.  Atty Sumpter and Def confirm resolution. Court undertakes colloquy as to Def's attorney appearing via telephone.  Def agrees with her appearance via telephone today.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea (OAR 1):  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by Def:  Yes - explains nature of driving on the offense date.  The Court:  Understands nature of driving and accepts recommendation.  Imposes Court Costs - bond to be applied - 60 DTP Bal or PP.  Costs to include DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Andrea Love Sumpter in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Love Sumpter requesting a plea/sentencing hearing. The Court will allow Atty Love Sumpter to appear by phone at the plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:05 PM: Defendant Andres Carmona Ramirez in court, in person, with attorney Love Sumpter, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.    Interpreter oath given by the Court.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Counsel requests that long form complaint be mailed to her with - Reading Waived.    Court authorizes release with a $250 cash bond w/conditions.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 03:20 pm.
